content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `find_mode`. It computes mode over arbitrary array. Provide an example

```julia
function find_mode(arr::AbstractArray)
    if length(unique(arr)) == 1
        return unique(arr)[1]
    else
        modes = findfirst(x -> occurrences(arr, x) == maximum(occurrences(arr, x)) for x in unique(arr))
        return unique(arr)[modes[1]]
    end
end

# Example
arr = [1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 3, 4, 4, 4, 4]
println(find_mode(arr)) # Output: 4
```

This `find_mode` function computes the mode of an arbitrary array by finding the unique elements with the maximum occurrences. It uses the `unique`, `findfirst`, and `occurrences` functions available in the Julia standard library.
